content:
BevelBitmapEffect Class

Definition

Note: This API is now obsolete. The non-obsolete alternative is Effect. Creates a bevel which raises the surface of the image according to a specified curve.

In this Article

public sealed class BevelBitmapEffect : System.Windows.Media.Effects.BitmapEffect

Remarks

Note

WPF bitmap effects are software rendered. Any object that applies an effect will also be rendered in software. Bitmap effects should not be applied to large visuals or animations as this can degrade performance.

The type of bevel (bevel curve) is determined by the EdgeProfile property.

BevelBitmapEffect is one of several effects that are shipped with the SDK. Other effects include:

  • OuterGlowBitmapEffect
  • BlurBitmapEffect
  • DropShadowBitmapEffect
  • EmbossBitmapEffect

The following illustration shows a BevelBitmapEffect applied to a visual object (in this case applied to a Button).

The following illustrations show the effect of several basic properties of BevelBitmapEffect.

The BevelWidth property specifies how wide the bevel is:

The EdgeProfile property specifies the curve of the bevel:

The Relief property specifies the relief of the bevel:

The Smoothness property specifies how smooth the shadows of the bevel are:

The LightAngle property specifies from which direction the "virtual light" is coming from that creates the shadows of the bevel:

Properties

BevelWidth

Note: This API is now obsolete. The non-obsolete alternative is Effect. Gets or sets the width of the bevel.

public double BevelWidth { get; set; }
Value
Double

The width of the bevel. The default value is 5.

Remarks

The following illustration demonstrates the effect of this property:

Dependency Property Information
Identifier field BevelWidthProperty
Metadata properties set to true None

EdgeProfile

Note: This API is now obsolete. The non-obsolete alternative is Effect. Gets or sets the curve of the bevel.

public System.Windows.Media.Effects.EdgeProfile EdgeProfile { get; set; }
Value
EdgeProfile

The curve of the bevel. The default value is EdgeProfile.

Remarks

The following illustration demonstrates the effect of this property:

Dependency Property Information
Identifier field EdgeProfileProperty
Metadata properties set to true None

LightAngle

Note: This API is now obsolete. The non-obsolete alternative is Effect. Gets or sets the direction the "virtual light" is coming from that creates the shadows of the bevel.

public double LightAngle { get; set; }
Value
Double

The direction of the virtual light source. The valid range is from 0-360 (degrees) with 0 specifying the right-hand side of the object and successive values moving counter-clockwise around the object. The shadows of the bevel are on the opposite side of where the light is cast. The default value is 135.

Remarks

The following diagram shows what direction light comes from for a given value of this property. Shadows of the bevel are cast on the opposite side from the light angle.

The following illustration demonstrates the effect of this property:

Dependency Property Information
Identifier field LightAngleProperty
Metadata properties set to true None

Relief

Note: This API is now obsolete. The non-obsolete alternative is Effect. Gets or sets the height of the relief of the bevel.

public double Relief { get; set; }
Value
Double

The height of the relief of the bevel. The valid range is between 0 and 1 with 1 having the most relief (darkest shadows). The default value is 0.3.

Remarks

The following illustration demonstrates the effect of this property:

Dependency Property Information
Identifier field ReliefProperty
Metadata properties set to true None

Smoothness

Note: This API is now obsolete. The non-obsolete alternative is Effect. Gets or sets how smooth the shadows of the bevel are.

public double Smoothness { get; set; }
Value
Double

Value indicating how smooth the bevel shadows are. The valid range is between 0 and 1 with 1 being the smoothest. The default value is 0.2.

Remarks

The following illustration demonstrates the effect of this property:

Dependency Property Information
Identifier field SmoothnessProperty
Metadata properties set to true None

Clone()

Note: This API is now obsolete. The non-obsolete alternative is Effect. Creates a modifiable clone of this BevelBitmapEffect, making deep copies of this object's values. When copying dependency properties, this method copies resource references and data bindings (but they might no longer resolve) but not animations or their current values.

public System.Windows.Media.Effects.BevelBitmapEffect Clone ();
Returns
BevelBitmapEffect

A modifiable clone of the current object. The cloned object's stem.Windows.Freezable.IsFrozen* property will be false even if the source's stem.Windows.Freezable.IsFrozen* property was true.

Remarks

This method is used to produce modifiable copies of frozen Freezable objects (or any Freezable object). For convenience, this method shadows the inherited version.

For more information, see Clone.
